thread.title: No lawn tractors: Dad told to find conventional way to pick up...
thread.title_full: No lawn tractors: Dad told to find conventional way to pick up... | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: No lawn tractors: Dad told to find conventional way to pick up...
text:
A Pennsylvania dad is going to have to find a new way to pick up his children from school.
Christopher Malloy had used a cart and a wagon hooked up to his riding lawn mower to pick up his daughters from Fort Washington Elementary School, WCAU reported.
>> Read more trending stories
But the principal told the Malloy and his wife Melissa in an email that they will have to find a more common mode of transportation.
A father is no longer allowed to use his lawn mower to pick his daughters up from school: http://nbc4dc.com/aFHXmCy
Posted by NBC Washington on Wednesday, October 14, 2015 "[The letter said] for me to let my husband know they wanted to stick to traditional methods of pickup in car line," Melissa said.
The school district superintendent told WCAU that school officials were concerned for the students' safety since the riding mower was being driven during a busy time of the day when there was a lot of traffic.
While disappointed, the Malloy’s will comply with the request.
